title: Firefox Not Opening My Website – Is It a Browser Issue?
content:
Hey everyone,

I’m facing an issue where my website (https://blifemodapk.com/) won’t open in Firefox, but it loads fine on Chrome and Edge. I’ve tried:

Clearing cache & cookies Disabling extensions & running Firefox in Safe Mode Checking my internet connection & trying a different network Still, it won’t load. Is this a Firefox-specific issue, or could it be something on my end? Can someone check if the site opens for them?

Would really appreciate any help! Thanks
creator: stephanydhantar

title: When ever I open Firefox browser around ten old tabs are there. I close them and they come back, always
content: When I open Firefox browser around ten several weeks old tabs are there. It is not set in the setting to open. I did many attempts to get rid of this nuisance and they are still here. I Created new profile, erased all profiles, removed Firefox, and reinstalled with option not to use old setting since new installation found that the fire fox has been installed. And frustration part that Mozilla do not offer (as I know) support to fix this problem. This glitch is hidden somewhere and the program always find it an put it back. I am not sure if what to do as I run out of options, other than turn to another browser after many years using only Firefox with no problems at all. Thanks Ned

title: Add-ons Suddenly Don't Work
content: I checked my add-ons in settings to see what was wrong as I noticed the icons were missing. Upon looking at the proper tab, everything "could not be verified" (including themes) even though everything was working perfectly within 24 hours prior to the issue arising. When trying to reinstall anything from the extension store, all I receive is a "this appears to be corrupt and thus will not install." Clicking the "more information" button on any/all affected add-ons reveals that everything is unsigned. How do I alleviate this?

title: Unbranded build disabled my add-on (ublock) because of expired CA TLS cert, shouldn't have.
content:
Well, it's happened. I am using the unbranded build specifically so that I do not have to have signed or verified extensions. But tonight my browser broke anyway because of the expiring CA TLS certs for the add-ons repository.

"One or more installed add-ons cannot be verified and have been disabled [Learn More]". If I click the [Learn More] button nothing happens. It just disappears.

And when I check: "uBlock Origin could not be verified for use in Nightly and has been disabled."

This should not be happening in the unbranded builds. I imagine it is happening in the custom Debian esr too. They're supposed to allow unsigned/unverified extensions/add-ons but now this apparently bug is happening.

To be clear, this was expected for normal Firefox releases with all normal extension signing stuff. But that was explicitly not supposed to be required for the unbranded builds. And so this is a bug.
creator: mozilla706

title: Firefox will not me log into my e-mail provider AT$T (Yahoo)
content:
I can log-in to my e-mail account using FireFox "Private Browser" and all other browsers, but not from Firefox's normal browser. I receive a message form ATT/Yahoo that something is wrong with my internet of WiFi.

I have been struggling with this off and on for several months. But all of a sudden when I went to log-in the normal FF browser so I could send screen shots, I was able to log-in. Within the last hour I couldn't log-in and have did nothing but read community questions and answers. This happening out of the has destroyed my efficiency.

Any ideas?

Allen Gauthier

title: can't sign into firefox after changing email
content:

My old email brings up an account to sign into but then it asks me to use the primary email. Any help would be appreciated.
